'Dédé la Sardine' and Russian oil: Inside the affair that has haunted Total for 15 years
Subhead: Seven people have been ordered to stand trial for their involvement in an arbitration process that was allegedly manipulated in order to extract the equivalent of €16 billion from French oil company Total. Their trial begins on Monday.

Russia's former liberal elite adopts the Kremlin's anti-European rhetoric
Subhead: Silenced since the start of the war in Ukraine, former Russian liberals have hardened their rhetoric following the collapse of ceasefire negotiations. Once critical of the Kremlin, they now blame Europe, accusing it of fueling the ongoing war.

Title: Acclaimed British playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
Subhead: To non-theatre-goers, Stoppard is best remembered for cinema work that included the 'Indiana Jones' and 'Star Wars' franchises and an Oscar in 1999 for 'Shakespeare in Love'.

Title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
Subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.

Title: 'Help us talk about the body with our children': Sex and relationship workshops reach disadvantaged French neighborhoods
Subhead: From talking about intimacy at home to learning about consent and exploring equality in relationships, the central city of Angoulême is fostering dialogue with residents in socio-economic difficulty.

Can French citizens be mobilized in the event of war?
Subhead: Statements by General Fabien Mandon and President Emmanuel Macron's announcements about a voluntary national service have raised questions about a scenario that, until recently, seemed unimaginable.

Title: Leaked transcripts unveil Trump envoy's closeness to Russians: 'I have the utmost respect for President Putin'
Subhead: Bloomberg has revealed conversations illustrating the close relationship between the Steve Witkoff and his contacts in Moscow.

Title: Inside the archives of shoemaker Roger Vivier
Subhead: This star shoemaker of the 1930s through the 1990s spent his long career experimenting with all kinds of designs. His archives, a testament to his boundless creativity, are now housed in a Parisian hôtel particulier.
